intro: Rhododendron wadanum var. lagopus, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its striking white bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountain forests. Its leaves are dark green and leathery, providing a striking contrast to its pale flowers. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in horticulture and its ecological role in its native habitat.
